instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> data line issue
threads.message:
i have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with only the upper usb port, both sides, doesn't read the data line.
So, 
The problem persists on both port, in both connection ways? NO
Do you get 5V at external USB device? No

Visual inspection doesn't show anything obvious. 
Is this a <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> data line issue
threads.message:
So machine works, just one port doesn't have USB communication?
The charger works connected to that port?

You may have problems with corresponding <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip, or the small redriver chip.
Also inspect USB-C terminals for corrosion.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> data line issue
threads.message:
So machine works, just one port doesn't have USB communication? YES
The charger works connected to that port? YES

I replaced the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> and exactly same issue there. 
What is the same redeliver chip?

usb c port looks good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> data line issue
threads.message:
It was so many times mentioned on the forum...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> data line issue
threads.message:
i relaced 3 times the redriver and 2 times the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> without success.
Looks like after NVRAM is able to read the external drive without succeeding the boot because gives a lock symbol.

What should I do?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> data line issue
threads.message:
You may have problems with corresponding lines connected to <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>.
Bad <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>, or some external components connected on these lines.
